5-5-2.graph_title: Proportion of women in managerial positions
5-5-2.indicator_name: Proportion of women in managerial positions

sources.url_text: Survey on the population in relation to activity

5-5-2.indicador_disponible: Proportion of women in managerial positions
5-5-2.objetivo_global: 5- Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
5-5-2.meta_global: 5.5 Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life
5-5-2.definicion: Proportion of women employed in managerial positions, senior management, and entrepeneurs in relation to the total number of people employed in these positions or economic activities.
5-5-2.formula:
$$PDIR_{women}^{t} = \frac{DIR_{women}^{t}}{DIR_{women}^{t}+DIR_{men}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where:

$DIR_{women}^{t} =$ women in the corresponding occupation in the year $t$

$DIR_{men}^{t} =$ men in the corresponding occupation in the year $t$
5-5-2.observaciones:
Management positions are defined as all occupations included in Group 1 of the CNO-2011, while senior 
management occupations are defined as those belonging to subgroups 11, 12, and 13 of the CNO-2011. 

Group 1 of the CNO-2011 includes administration and management jobs, whose main tasks are to plan, 
direct and coordinate the general activity of companies, governments or other organisations, and to 
formulate and review company strategies and government legislation. This group is subdivided into 
five main subgroups: 

11 Members of the executive power and of the legislative bodies; directors of the Public Administration 
and social interest organisations
12 Directors of administrative and commercial departments
13 Directors of production and operations
14 Directors and managers of accommodation, catering and trading companies
15 Directors and managers of other companies offering services not classified in other sections

Women entrepreneurs are those who are self-employed.
5-5-2.justificacion_global:
The indicator provides information on the proportion of women who are employed in decision-making 
and management roles in government, large enterprises and institutions, thus providing some insight into 
women’s power in decision making and in the economy (especially compared to men's power in those 
areas).

It is recommended to use two different measures jointly for this indicator: the share of females 
in (total) management and the share of females in senior and middle management (thus excluding junior 
management). The joint calculation of these two measures provides information on whether women are 
more represented in junior management than in senior and middle management, thus pointing to an 
eventual ceiling for women to access higher-level management positions. In these cases, calculating only 
the share of women in (total) management would be misleading, in that it would suggest that women 
hold positions with more decision-making power and responsibilities than they actually do. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
5-5-2.dato_global: Proportion of women in managerial positions - 13th ICLS (%) IC_GEN_MGTL UNSTATS
5-5-2.comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with United Nations metadata.

es.definicion: Proporción de mujeres ocupadas en cargos directivos, en la alta dirección, y mujeres empresarias respecto al total de personas ocupadas en esos cargos o actividades económicas.
es.formula:
$$PDIR_{mujeres}^{t} = \frac{DIR_{mujeres}^{t}}{DIR_{mujeres}^{t}+DIR_{hombres}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde:

$DIR_{mujeres}^{t} =$ mujeres en la ocupación correspondiente en el año $t$

$DIR_{hombres}^{t} =$ hombres en la ocupación correspondiente en en el año $t$
es.observaciones:
Se entiende por cargos directivos todas las ocupaciones incluidas en el grupo 1 de la CNO-2011, 
mientras que se entiende por alta dirección aquellas ocupaciones pertenecientes a los 
subgrupos 11, 12 y 13 de la CNO-2011.

El grupo 1 de la CNO-2011 comprende las ocupaciones de dirección y gerencia, cuyas tareas 
principales son planificar, dirigir y coordinar la actividad general de las empresas, 
gobiernos u otras organizaciones, así como formular y revisar la estrategia de las empresas 
y normativas de los gobiernos. Este grupo se subdivide en cinco subgrupos principales:

 11 Miembros del poder ejecutivo y de los cuerpos legislativos; directivos de la Administración Pública y organizaciones de interés social; directores ejecutivos
 12 Directores de departamentos administrativos y comerciales
 13 Directores de producción y operaciones
 14 Directores y gerentes de empresas de alojamiento, restauración y comercio
 15 Directores y gerentes de otras empresas de servicios no clasificados bajo otros epígrafes

Se entiende por mujeres empresarias las que ejercen una actividad económica por cuenta propia.
es.justificacion_global:
El indicador proporciona información sobre la proporción de mujeres empleadas 
en puestos de toma de decisiones y gestión en el gobierno, grandes empresas e 
instituciones, lo que proporciona una idea del poder de las mujeres en la toma de decisiones 
y en la economía (especialmente en comparación con el poder de los hombres en esas áreas).

Se recomienda utilizar dos medidas diferentes de forma conjunta para este 
indicador: la proporción de mujeres en la gestión (total) y la proporción de mujeres en la 
gestión superior e intermedia (excluyendo así la gestión de nivel inferior). El cálculo conjunto 
de estas dos medidas proporciona información sobre si las mujeres están más representadas en 
la gestión de bajo nivel que en la gestión superior e intermedia, lo que 
indica que existe un techo para el acceso de las mujeres a puestos directivos de 
nivel superior. En estos casos, calcular solo la proporción de mujeres en la gestión (total) 
sería engañoso, ya que sugeriría que las mujeres ocupen puestos con más poder de 
decisión y responsabilidades de las que realmente ocupan.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas

10-1-1.graph_title: Growth rates of household expenditure or income per capita among the bottom 40 per cent of the population and the total population
10-1-1.indicator_name: Growth rates of household expenditure or income per capita among the bottom 40 per cent of the population and the total population
10-1-1.page_content: Desired direction: Sustain income growth of the bottom 40 per cent of the population at a rate higher than the national average

sources.organisation: Department of Welfare, Youth and Demographic Challenge
sources.url_text: Survey on Poverty and Social Inequalities (EPDS)

10-1-1.indicador_disponible: Growth rates of household expenditure or income per capita among the bottom 40 per cent of the population and the total population
10-1-1.objetivo_global: 10- Reduce inequality within and among countries
10-1-1.meta_global: 10.1 By 2030, progressively achieve and sustain income growth of the bottom 40 per cent of the population at a rate higher than the national average
10-1-1.definicion: Average annualized growth rate over a five-year period of income and expenditure per  capita of households in the poorest 40% of the population of the autonomous community  (40% of people with the lowest income per consumption unit (modified OECD scale)) and  of the total population.
10-1-1.formula:
The annualized growth in average real per capita income or consumption is calculated by 
first estimating the average real per capita income or consumption of the bottom 40% of 
the welfare distribution in years T0 and T1 and then calculating the average annual growth 
rate between those years using a compound growth formula: 

Crecimiento del ingreso o consumo = $$\left( \frac{Average\, T_1}{Average\, T_0} \right)^{\frac{1}{T_1 - T_0}} - 1$$


The growth in average real per capita income or consumption of the total population is 
calculated in the same way using data for the total population.
10-1-1.observaciones: The number of units of consumption of a household is calculated using the modified OECD scale,  which assigns a weighting of 1 to the first person aged 14 or over, a weighting of 0.5 to other  persons aged 14 or over and a weighting of 0.3 to persons under the age of 14.
10-1-1.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
10-1-1.justificacion_global:
Improvements in shared prosperity require both a growing economy and a consideration 
of equity. Shared prosperity explicitly recognizes that while growth is necessary for 
improving economic welfare in a society, progress is measured by how those gains are 
shared with its poorest members.  

Moreover, in an inclusive society it is not sufficient to raise everyone above an 
absolute minimum standard of living; it must ensure that economic growth increases 
prosperity among the poor over time. 

The decision to measure shared prosperity based on income or consumption was not taken 
to ignore the many other dimensions of welfare. It is motivated by the need for an 
indicator that is easy to understand, communicate, and measure – though measurement 
challenges exist. Indeed, shared prosperity comprises many dimensions of well-being 
of the less well-off, and when analyzing shared prosperity in the context of a country, 
it is important to consider a wide range of indicators of welfare. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
10-1-1.comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with United Nations metadata.

es.indicador_disponible: Growth rates of household expenditure or income per capita among the bottom 40 per cent of the population and the total population
es.objetivo_global: 10- Reduce inequality within and among countries
es.meta_global: 10.1 By 2030, progressively achieve and sustain income growth of the bottom 40 per cent of the population at a rate higher than the national average
es.definicion: Tasa de crecimiento promedio anualizada en un período de cinco años de los ingresos y gastos por persona de los hogares del 40% más pobre de la población de la comunidad autónoma (40% de las personas con menores ingresos por unidad de consumo (escala OCDE modificada)) y del total de la población.
es.formula:
El crecimiento anualizado del ingreso real medio per cápita o del consumo se calcula 
estimando primero el ingreso real medio per cápita o el consumo del 40% inferior de la 
distribución del bienestar en los años T0 y T1 y luego calculando la tasa de crecimiento 
promedio anual entre esos años utilizando una fórmula de crecimiento compuesto:

Crecimiento del ingreso o consumo = $$\left( \frac{Media\, en\, T_1}{Media\, en\, T_0} \right)^{\frac{1}{T_1 - T_0}} - 1$$


El crecimiento del ingreso real per cápita medio o del consumo de la población total 
se calcula de la misma manera utilizando datos de la población total.
es.observaciones: El número de unidades de consumo de un hogar se calcula utilizando la escala OCDE modificada,  que asigna un peso de 1 a la primera persona de 14 o más años, un peso de 0,5 al resto de  personas de 14 o más años y un peso de 0,3 a las personas de menos de 14 años.
es.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
es.justificacion_global:
Las mejoras en la prosperidad compartida requieren tanto una economía en crecimiento como 
una consideración de la equidad. La prosperidad compartida reconoce explícitamente que si 
bien el crecimiento es necesario para mejorar el bienestar económico 
en una sociedad, el progreso se mide por la forma en que esas ganancias se comparten 
con sus miembros más pobres. 

Además, en una sociedad inclusiva no es suficiente elevar a todos por encima de un nivel 
de vida mínimo absoluto, debe garantizarse que el crecimiento económico aumente la 
prosperidad entre los pobres a lo largo del tiempo.

La decisión de medir la prosperidad compartida en función del ingreso o el consumo 
no se tomó para ignorar las muchas otras dimensiones del bienestar. Está motivada por la 
necesidad de un indicador que sea fácil de entender, comunicar y medir, aunque existen 
desafíos de medición. De hecho, la prosperidad compartida comprende muchas dimensiones 
del bienestar de los menos favorecidos, y al analizar la prosperidad compartida en 
el contexto de un país, es importante considerar una amplia gama de indicadores de bienestar.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas

14-3-1.graph_title: Average marine acidity (pH) measured at agreed suite of representative sampling stations
14-3-1.indicator_name: Average marine acidity (pH) measured at agreed suite of representative sampling stations
14-3-1.indicador_disponible: Average sea acidity (pH) measured at an agreed set of representative sampling stations
14-3-1.objetivo_global: 14- Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
14-3-1.meta_global: 14.3 Minimize and address the impacts of ocean acidification, including through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels
14-3-1.definicion: Average sea acidity (pH) measured at an agreed set of representative sampling stations
14-3-1.formula:
$${AMM}^t = \overline{pH^t}$$

where:

$\overline{pH^t}=$ arithmetic mean of the in-situ pH collected on the 15th of each month at the measuring stations in year $t$
14-3-1.observaciones: The allocation of measuring stations by autonomous communities is carried out according to their nearest land point
14-3-1.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
14-3-1.justificacion_global:
The ocean absorbs up to 30% of the annual emissions of anthropogenic CO2 to the atmosphere, helping 
to alleviate the impacts of climate change on the planet. However, this comes at a steep ecological cost, 
as the absorbed CO2 reacts with seawater and results in shifts in the dissolved carbonate chemistry 
including increased acidity levels in the marine environment (decreased seawater pH). 

Ocean acidification has potentially direct consequences for marine life and cascades through to the 
services provided by the open ocean and coastal areas including food and livelihood, tourism, coastal 
protection, cultural identity, transportation and recreation. The impacts on ocean services from ocean 
acidification may be lessened through appropriate monitoring and improved understanding of variability 
and rates of change, helping to inform mitigation and/or adaptation strategies. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
14-3-1.comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with the United Nations metadata

es.objetivo_global: 14- Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
es.meta_global: 14.3 Minimize and address the impacts of ocean acidification, including through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels
es.definicion: Acidez media del mar (pH) medida en un conjunto convenido de estaciones de muestreo representativas
es.formula:
$${AMM}^t = \overline{pH^t}$$

donde:

$\overline{pH^t}=$ media aritmética del pH in-situ recogido el día 15 de cada mes en las estaciones de medición en el año $t$
es.observaciones: La asignación de las estaciones de medición por comunidades autónomas se realiza atendiendo a su punto de tierra más cercano
es.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
es.justificacion_global:
El océano absorbe hasta el 30 % de las emisiones anuales de CO2 antropogénico a la atmósfera, 
lo que ayuda a mitigar los impactos del cambio climático en el planeta. Sin embargo, 
esto tiene un alto coste ecológico, ya que el CO2 absorbido reacciona con el agua 
de mar y provoca cambios en la composición química de los carbonatos disueltos, 
incluyendo un aumento de la acidez en el medio marino (disminución del pH del agua 
de mar). 

La acidificación de los océanos tiene consecuencias potencialmente directas para la vida 
marina y repercute en los servicios que prestan el océano abierto y las zonas costeras, 
como la alimentación y los medios de vida, el turismo, la protección costera, la identidad cultural, 
el transporte y la recreación. Los impactos de la acidificación de los océanos en los 
servicios oceánicos pueden reducirse mediante un monitoreo adecuado y una mejor comprensión 
de la variabilidad y las tasas de cambio, lo que ayuda a fundamentar las estrategias 
de mitigación y/o adaptación.

3-a-1.graph_title: Proportion of people aged 15 and over who smoke daily
3-a-1.indicator_name: Age-standardized prevalence of current tobacco use among persons aged 15 years and older
3-a-1.indicador_disponible: Proportion of people aged 15 and over who smoke daily
3-a-1.objetivo_global: 3- Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-a-1.meta_global: 3.a Strengthen the implementation of the World Health Organization Framework Convention on Tobacco Control in all countries, as appropriate
3-a-1.definicion: Proportion of people aged 15 and over who smoke daily
3-a-1.formula:
$$PPFD_{15+}^{t} = \frac{PFD_{15+}^{t}}{P_{15+}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where:

$PFD_{15+}^{t} =$ population aged 15 and over who smoke daily in the year $t$
$P_{15y+}^{t} =$ population aged 15 and over in year $t$
3-a-1.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
3-a-1.justificacion_global:
The United Nations indicator is defined as the percentage of the population 
aged 15 years and over who currently use any tobacco product (smoked and/or 
smokeless tobacco) on a daily or non-daily basis.

Tobacco use is a major contributor to illness and death from non-communicable 
diseases (NCDs). There is no proven safe level of tobacco use or of second-hand 
smoke exposure. All daily and non-daily users of tobacco are at risk of a variety 
of poor health outcomes across the life-course, including NCDs.

Reducing the prevalence of current tobacco use will make a large contribution to 
reducing premature mortality from NCDs (Target 3.4).

Routine and regular monitoring of this indicator is necessary to enable accurate 
monitoring and evaluation of the impact of implementation of the WHO Framework 
Convention on Tobacco Control (WHO FCTC), or tobacco control policies in the 
countries that are not yet Parties to the WHO FCTC, over time.

Tobacco use prevalence levels are an appropriate indicator of implementation 
of SDG Target 3.a “Strengthen the implementation of the World Health Organization 
Framework Convention on Tobacco Control in all countries, as appropriate”. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division

es.justificacion_global:
El indicador de Naciones Unidas se define como el porcentaje de la población de 15 años o más que 
actualmente consume algún producto de tabaco (tabaco fumado y/o sin humo) de manera diaria o no diaria.

El consumo de tabaco es una de las principales causas de enfermedad y muerte por enfermedades no transmisibles (ENT). 
No se ha demostrado que el consumo de tabaco o la exposición al humo de tabaco ajeno sean seguros. Todos los consumidores 
diarios y no diarios de tabaco corren el riesgo de sufrir diversos problemas de salud a lo largo de la vida, 
incluidas las ENT.

Reducir la prevalencia del consumo actual de tabaco contribuirá en gran medida a reducir la mortalidad prematura por 
ENT (meta 3.4).

El seguimiento sistemático y regular de este indicador es necesario para permitir un seguimiento y 
una evaluación precisos del impacto de la aplicación del Convenio Marco de la OMS para el Control del Tabaco 
(CMCT de la OMS) o de las políticas de control del tabaco en los países que aún no son Partes en el CMCT de la OMS, 
a lo largo del tiempo.

Los niveles de prevalencia del consumo de tabaco son un indicador adecuado de la aplicación 
de la meta 3.a de los ODS “Fortalecer la aplicación del Convenio Marco de la Organización Mundial de la Salud para el 
Control del Tabaco en todos los países, según proceda”. 

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas

5-a-1.indicator_name: (a) Proportion of total agricultural population with ownership or secure rights over agricultural land, by sex; and (b) share of women among owners or rights-bearers of agricultural land, by type of tenure

sources.url_text: Survey on the Structure of Agricultural Farms

5-a-1.indicador_disponible: (a) Proportion of total agricultural population with ownership or secure rights over agricultural land, by sex; and (b) share of women among owners or rights-bearers of agricultural land, by type of tenure
5-a-1.objetivo_global: 5- Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
5-a-1.meta_global: 5.a Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws
5-a-1.definicion: Proportion of heads of agricultural holdings, to the total number of agricultural workers and  proportion of female heads of agricultural holdings to the total number of heads of agricultural  holdings, by type of tenure.
5-a-1.formula:
Proportion of heads of agricultural holdings, to the total number of agricultural workers $$PPOA_{head}^{t} = \frac{TEA^{t}}{POA^{t}} \cdot 100$$ where: $TEA^{t} =$ heads of agricultural holdings in year $t$ $POA^{t} =$ people employed in agriculture in year $t$
proportion of female heads of agricultural holdings to the total number of heads of agricultural holdings, by type of tenure $$PTEA_{women}^{t} = \frac{TEA_{women}^{t}}{TEA^{t}} \cdot 100$$ where: $TEA_{women}^{t} =$ female heads of agricultural holdings in year $t$ by type of tenure $TEA^{t} =$ heads of agricultural holdings in year $t$ by type of tenure
5-a-1.observaciones:
Sub-indicator 5.a.1 (a) is a prevalence measure. It measures the prevalence of people 
in the agricultural population with ownership or secure rights over agricultural land, disaggregated by sex. 

Sub-indicator 5.a.1 (b) focuses on gender parity, measuring the extent to which women are disadvantaged 
in ownership or secure rights over agricultural land.
5-a-1.justificacion_global:
Indicator 5.a.1 aims to monitor the gender balance on ownership/secure rights over agricultural land. 
Subindicator (a) and sub-indicator (b) are based on the same data and they monitor ownership/rights from 
two different angles. 

While sub-indicator (a) uses the total male/female agricultural population as reference population, 
and it tells us how many male/female own land, sub-indicator (b) focuses on the agricultural population 
with land ownership/secure rights, and it tells us how many of them are women. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
5-a-1.comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with United Nations metadata.

es.definicion: Proporción de titulares de explotaciones agrícolas respecto al total de personas trabajadoras  en la agricultura y proporción de mujeres titulares de explotaciones agrícolas respecto al  total de titulares de explotaciones agrícolas desglosada por tipo de tenencia.
es.formula:
Proporción de titulares de explotaciones agrícolas respecto al total de personas trabajadoras en la agricultura $$PPOA_{titulares}^{t} = \frac{TEA^{t}}{POA^{t}} \cdot 100$$ donde: $TEA^{t} =$ personas titulares de explotaciones agrícolas en el año $t$ $POA^{t} =$ personas ocupadas en la agricultura en el año $t$
Proporción de mujeres titulares de explotaciones agrícolas respecto al total de titulares de explotaciones agrícolas desglosada por tipo de tenencia $$PTEA_{mujeres}^{t} = \frac{TEA_{mujeres}^{t}}{TEA^{t}} \cdot 100$$ donde: $TEA_{mujeres}^{t} =$ mujeres titulares de explotaciones agrícolas en el año $t$ por tipo de tenencia $TEA^{t} =$ personas titulares de explotaciones agrícolas en el año $t$ por tipo de tenencia
es.desagregacion:
Tipo de tenencia 

Sexo 

Territorio histórico
es.observaciones:
El subindicador 5.a.1 (a) es una medida de prevalencia. Mide la prevalencia de personas 
en la población agrícola con propiedad o derechos seguros sobre tierras agrícolas, 
desglosada por sexo.

El subindicador 5.a.1 (b) se centra en la paridad de género y mide en qué medida 
las mujeres se encuentran en desventaja en la propiedad o en los derechos seguros 
sobre las tierras agrícolas.
es.justificacion_global:
El indicador 5.a.1 tiene como objetivo monitorear el equilibrio de género en 
la propiedad/derechos seguros sobre tierras agrícolas. El subindicador (a) y 
el subindicador (b) se basan en los mismos datos y monitorean la propiedad/derechos 
desde dos ángulos diferentes.

Mientras que el subindicador (a) utiliza la población agrícola total masculina/femenina 
como población de referencia, y nos dice cuántos hombres/mujeres poseen tierras, 
el subindicador (b) se centra en la población agrícola con propiedad de la tierra/derechos 
seguros, y nos dice cuántas de ellas son mujeres.

OCECA-8-9-1-3AB4AB.objetivo_global: 8- Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
OCECA-8-9-1-3AB4AB.meta_global: 8.9 By 2030, devise and implement policies to promote sustainable tourism that creates jobs and promotes local culture and products
OCECA-8-9-1-3AB4AB.definicion: The indicator is composed of several series: - Tourist overnight stays per inhabitant: Resident and non-resident tourist overnight stays in the Autonomous Community, including residents abroad, as a percentage of the population - Overnight stays of non-resident tourists per inhabitant: Non-resident tourist overnight stays in the Autonomous Community, including residents abroad, as a percentage of the population - Proportion of overnight stays by tourists in the two months of maximum occupancy over the total overnight stays by tourists: Proportion of resident and non-resident tourist overnight stays in the Autonomous Community, including residents abroad, in the two months of peak occupancy as a percentage of the annual total - Proportion of overnight stays by non-resident tourists in the two months of maximum occupancy over the total overnight stays by non-resident tourists: Proportion of non-resident tourist overnight stays in the Autonomous Community, including residents abroad, in the two months maximum occupancy over its annual total
OCECA-8-9-1-3AB4AB.formula:
Tourist overnight stays per inhabitant $$PERNP^{t} = \frac{{PERN^{t}}}{P^{t}}$$ where: $PERN^{t} =$ overnight stays of resident and non-resident tourists in year $t$ $P^{t} =$ population as of July 1, year $t$
Overnight stays of non-resident tourists per inhabitant $$PERNP_{non\, residents}^{t} = \frac{{PERN_{non\, residents}^{t}}}{P^{t}}$$ where: $PERN_{non\, residents}^{t} =$ overnight stays of non-resident tourists in year $t$ $P^{t} =$ population as of July 1, year $t$
Proportion of overnight stays by tourists in the two months of maximum occupancy over the total overnight stays by tourists $$PERNP_{2\, months\, max}^{t} = \frac{{PERN_{2\, months\, max}^{t}}}{PERN^{t}}$$ where: $PERN_{2\, months\, max}^{t} =$ overnight stays by resident and non-resident tourists in the two months of peak occupancy of the year $t$ $PERN^{t} =$ overnight stays by resident and non-resident tourists in year $t$
Proportion of overnight stays by non-resident tourists in the two months of maximum occupancy over the total overnight stays by non-resident tourists $$PERNP_{non\, residents\, 2\, months\, max}^{t} = \frac{{PERN_{non\, residents\, 2\, meses\, months}^{t}}}{PERN_{non\, residents}^{t}}$$ where: $PERN_{non\, residents\, 2\, meses\, months}^{t} =$ overnight stays by non-resident tourists in the two months of peak occupancy of the year $t$ $PERN_{non\, residents}^{t} =$ overnight stays by non-resident tourists in year $t$

Pernoctaciones de turistas no residentes por habitante $$PERNP_{no\, residentes}^{t} = \frac{{PERN_{no\, residentes}^{t}}}{P^{t}}$$ donde: $PERN_{no\, residentes}^{t} =$ pernoctaciones de turistas no residentes en el año $t$ $P^{t} =$ población a 1 de julio del año $t$
Proporción de pernoctaciones de turistas en los dos meses de máxima ocupación sobre el total de pernoctaciones de turistas $$PERNP_{2\, meses\, max}^{t} = \frac{{PERN_{2\, meses\, max}^{t}}}{PERN^{t}}$$ donde: $PERN_{2\, meses\, max}^{t} =$ pernoctaciones de turistas residentes y no residentes en los dos meses de máxima ocupación del año $t$ $PERN^{t} =$ pernoctaciones de turistas residentes y no residentes en el año $t$ Proporción de pernoctaciones de turistas no residentes en los dos meses de máxima ocupación sobre el total de pernoctaciones de turistas no residentes $$PERNP_{no\, residentes\, 2\, meses\, max}^{t} = \frac{{PERN_{no\, residentes\, 2\, meses\, max}^{t}}}{PERN_{no\, residentes}^{t}}$$ donde: $PERN_{no\, residentes\, 2\, meses\, max}^{t} =$ pernoctaciones de turistas no residentes en los dos meses de máxima ocupación del año $t$ $PERN_{no\, residentes}^{t} =$ pernoctaciones de turistas no residentes en el año $t$

The safeguard of important sites is vital for stemming the decline in biodiversity and ensuring long term 
and sustainable use of mountain natural resources. The establishment of protected areas is an important 
mechanism for achieving this aim, and this indicator serves as a means of measuring progress toward the 
conservation, restoration and sustainable use of mountain ecosystems and their services, in line with 
obligations under international agreements. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division

es.objetivo_global: 15- Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
es.meta_global: 15.4 By 2030, ensure the conservation of mountain ecosystems, including their biodiversity, in order to enhance their capacity to provide benefits that are essential for sustainable development
es.definicion: Porcentaje de los lugares importantes para la biodiversidad de las montañas (aquellos que contribuyen significativamente a la persistencia global de la biodiversidad) que está cubierto por áreas protegidas
es.formula:
$$PKBA_{montaña}^{t} = \frac{APKBA_{montaña}^{t}}{KBA_{montaña}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde:

$APKBA_{montaña}^{t} =$ superficie de los lugares importantes para la biodiversidad de las montañas cubierta por áreas protegidas en el año $t$

$KBA_{montaña}^{t}  =$ superficie de los lugares importantes para la biodiversidad de las montañas en el año $t$
es.justificacion_global:
La protección de lugares importantes es vital para frenar la pérdida de biodiversidad 
y garantizar el uso sostenible a largo plazo de los recursos naturales de montaña. 
El establecimiento de áreas protegidas es un mecanismo clave para lograr este objetivo, 
y este indicador sirve para medir el progreso hacia la conservación, la restauración y 
el uso sostenible de los ecosistemas de montaña y sus servicios, de conformidad con las 
obligaciones contraídas en virtud de los acuerdos internacionales.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas

14-5-1.graph_title: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas
14-5-1.indicator_name: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas
14-5-1.indicador_disponible: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas
14-5-1.objetivo_global: 14- Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
14-5-1.meta_global: 14.5 By 2020, conserve at least 10 per cent of coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information
14-5-1.definicion: Percentage of important sites for marine biodiversity (those that contribute significantly to the global persistence of biodiversity) that are covered by protected areas
14-5-1.formula:
$$PKBA_{mar}^{t} = \frac{APKBA_{mar}^{t}}{KBA_{mar}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where:

$APKBA_{mar}^{t} =$ area of ​​important sites for marine biodiversity covered by protected areas in year $t$

$KBA_{mar} =$ surface area of ​​important sites for marine biodiversity in year $t$
14-5-1.justificacion_global:
The safeguard of important sites is vital for stemming the decline in biodiversity and ensuring long term 
and sustainable use of marine natural resources. The establishment of protected areas is an important 
mechanism for achieving this aim, and this indicator serves as a means of measuring progress toward the 
conservation, restoration and sustainable use of marine ecosystems and their services, in line with 
obligations under international agreements. 

This indicator adds meaningful information to, complements and builds from traditionally reported 
simple statistics of marine area covered by protected areas, computed by dividing the total protected 
area within a country by the total territorial area of the country and multiplying by 100 (e.g., Chape et al. 
2005). Such percentage area coverage statistics do not recognise the extreme variation of biodiversity 
importance over space (Rodrigues et al. 2004), and so risk generating perverse outcomes through the 
protection of areas which are large at the expense of those which require protection. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division

es.objetivo_global: 14- Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
es.meta_global: 14.5 By 2020, conserve at least 10 per cent of coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information
es.definicion: Porcentaje de los lugares importantes para la biodiversidad marina (aquellos que contribuyen significativamente a la persistencia global de la biodiversidad) que está cubierto por áreas protegidas
es.formula:
$$PKBA_{mar}^{t} = \frac{APKBA_{mar}^{t}}{KBA_{mar}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde:

$APKBA_{mar}^{t} =$ superficie de los lugares importantes para la biodiversidad marina cubierta por áreas protegidas en el año $t$

$KBA_{mar} =$ superficie de los lugares importantes para la biodiversidad marina en el año $t$
es.justificacion_global:
La protección de lugares importantes es vital para frenar la pérdida de biodiversidad 
y garantizar el uso sostenible a largo plazo de los recursos naturales marinos. 
El establecimiento de áreas protegidas es un mecanismo clave para lograr este objetivo, 
y este indicador sirve para medir el progreso hacia la conservación, la restauración y 
el uso sostenible de los ecosistemas marinos y sus servicios, de conformidad con las 
obligaciones contraídas en virtud de los acuerdos internacionales.

Este indicador aporta información significativa, complementa y amplía las 
estadísticas simples tradicionalmente reportadas sobre el área marina cubierta 
por áreas protegidas. Se calcula dividiendo el área protegida total de un país 
entre su superficie territorial total y multiplicando por 100 (p. ej., Chape et al., 2005). 
Estas estadísticas de cobertura porcentual no reconocen la extrema variación de la importancia 
de la biodiversidad en el espacio (Rodrigues et al., 2004), por lo que corren el riesgo de

10-4-2.graph_title: Gini index of equivalent disposable income (post-fiscal)

sources.organisation: Department of Welfare, Youth and Demographic Challenge
sources.url_text: Survey on Poverty and Social Inequalities (EPDS)

10-4-2.indicador_disponible: Gini index of equivalent disposable income (post-fiscal)
10-4-2.objetivo_global: 10- Reduce inequality within and among countries
10-4-2.meta_global: 10.4 Adopt policies, especially fiscal, wage and social protection policies, and progressively achieve greater equality
10-4-2.definicion:
The Gini index measures the statistical dispersion in income distribution 
within a population. It is used to compare inequality in income distribution 
across different territories. 

Its value is between 0 and 100, so the closer it is to 100, the greater the 
concentration of income, and the closer it is to 0, the more equitable the 
distribution of wealth.
10-4-2.formula:
$$I^{t}_{GINI} = \frac{A^t}{(A + B)^t}$$

where:

$A^{t} =$ Area over the Lorenz curve in the year $t$

$B^{t} =$ Area under the Lorenz curve in the year $t$
10-4-2.justificacion_global:
The Redistributive Impact of Fiscal Policy indicator demonstrates in an 
accounting framework the total amount by which current income inequality 
is reduced or increased by the current execution of fiscal policy (including 
direct and indirect taxes; social insurance and old-age pension contributions; 
direct cash or near-cash transfers; and subsidies). 

For example, if the Redistributive Impact of Fiscal Policy is positive, that 
indicates that the net effect of Fiscal Policy is to reduce the Gini index from 
what it otherwise would be without Fiscal Policy (in an accounting sense, not 
as an economic counterfactual). 

The indicator allows policy makers and the broader stakeholder and advocacy 
communities to systematically track progress at the country level in the 
contribution of fiscal policy to more equitable societies.
10-4-2.comparabilidad: The indicator partially complies with the UN indicator metadata.

es.indicador_disponible: Gini index of equivalent disposable income (post-fiscal)
es.objetivo_global: 10- Reduce inequality within and among countries
es.meta_global: 10.4 Adopt policies, especially fiscal, wage and social protection policies, and progressively achieve greater equality
es.definicion:
Índice de Gini de la renta disponible equivalente per cápita después de transferencias sociales (postfiscal). 

El Índice de Gini mide la dispersión estadística en la distribución del ingreso en una población. 
Se utiliza para comparar la desigualdad en la distribución de los ingresos en distintos
territorios. Su valor está entre 0 y 100, de manera que cuanto más próximo sea a 100, mayor será la 
concentración de los ingresos y cuanto más próximo a 0, más equitativa es la distribución de la riqueza.
es.formula:
$$I_{gini}^{t}= \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n-1} (P_i^{t} - Y_i^{t})}{\sum_{i=1}^{n-1} P_i^{t}}$$

donde:

$P_i^{t} =$ proporción acumulada de personas, ordenadas por ingreso ascendente, en el año $t$

$Y_i^{t} =$ proporción acumulada de ingresos correspondientes a esas personas en el año $t$

$n =$ número total de personas
es.observaciones: La renta equivalente es un valor derivado de los ingresos totales de un hogar y del número y la edad de las personas que viven de estos ingresos.
es.justificacion_global:
El indicador de Impacto Redistributivo de la Política Fiscal demuestra en un marco 
contable la cantidad total en la que la actual desigualdad de ingresos se reduce o 
aumenta mediante la ejecución de la política fiscal (incluidos los impuestos directos 
e indirectos; las contribuciones a la seguridad social y a las pensiones de vejez; 
las transferencias directas en efectivo o cuasiefectivo; y los subsidios). 

Por ejemplo, si el Impacto Redistributivo de la Política Fiscal es positivo, 
eso indica que el efecto neto de la política fiscal es reducir el índice de Gini respecto 
de lo que sería de otra manera sin la política fiscal (en un sentido contable, no como un 
contrafactual económico). 

El indicador permite a los responsables de las políticas y a las 
comunidades más amplias de partes interesadas y promotoras hacer un seguimiento sistemático del 
progreso a nivel de país en la contribución de la política fiscal a sociedades más equitativas.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
es.comparabilidad: El indicador cumple parcialmente con los metadatos del indicador de Naciones Unidas. Se presenta la serie correspondiente al índice de Gini postfiscal, pero no el índice de Gini prefiscal.

3-4-E1.graph_title: Participation rate in population-based cancer screening programs (Basque Government Indicator)
3-4-E1.indicator_name: Participation rate in population-based cancer screening programs (Basque Government Indicator)
3-4-E1.indicador_disponible: Participation rate in population-based cancer screening programs (Basque Government Indicator)
3-4-E1.objetivo_global: 3- Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-4-E1.meta_global: 3.4 By 2030, reduce by one third premature mortality from non-communicable diseases through prevention and treatment and promote mental health and well-being
3-4-E1.definicion: This indicator is composed of two series: - Percentage of participation in colorectal cancer screening programs among the target population (men and women aged 50 to 74) - Percentage of participation in breast cancer screening programs among the target population (women aged 50-69)
3-4-E1.formula: Percentage of participation in colorectal cancer screening programs among the target population (men and women aged 50 to 74) $$PP_{colorectal}^{t} = \frac{P_{colorectal}^{t}}{P_{T\, colorectal}^{t}} \cdot 100$$ where: $P_{colorectal}^{t} =$ number of participants in the colorectal cancer early detection program in year $t$ $P_{T\, colorectal}^{t} =$ target population of the colorectal cancer early detection program in year $t$ Percentage of participation in breast cancer screening programs among the target population (women aged 50-69) $$PP_{breast}^{t} = \frac{P_{breast}^{t}}{P_{T\, breast}^{t}} \cdot 100$$ where: $P_{breast}^{t} =$ number of participants in the breast cancer early detection program in year $t$ $P_{T\, breast}^{t} =$ target population of the breast cancer early detection program in year $t$
3-4-E1.observaciones: Until 2023, the target population for the colorectal cancer early detection program was men and women between 50 and 69 years of age. Starting in 2023, the population between 70 and 74 years of age was also included.
3-4-E1.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities

es.indicador_disponible: Participation rate in population-based cancer screening programs (Basque Government Indicator)
es.objetivo_global: 3- Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
es.meta_global: 3.4 By 2030, reduce by one third premature mortality from non-communicable diseases through prevention and treatment and promote mental health and well-being
es.definicion: Este indicador se compone de dos series: - Porcentaje de participación en los programas de cribado poblacional de cáncer colorrectal entre la población diana (hombres y mujeres de entre 50 y 74 años) - Porcentaje de participación en los programas de cribado poblacional de cáncer de mama entre la población diana (mujeres de entre 50 y 69 años)
es.formula: Porcentaje de participación en los programas de cribado poblacional de cáncer colorrectal entre la población diana (hombres y mujeres de entre 50 y 74 años) $$PP_{colorrectal}^{t} = \frac{P_{colorrectal}^{t}}{P_{D\, colorrectal}^{t}} \cdot 100$$ donde: $P_{colorrectal}^{t} =$ número de participantes en el programa de detección precoz de cáncer colorrectal en el año $t$ $P_{D\, colorrectal}^{t} =$ población diana del programa de detección precoz de cáncer colorrectal en el año $t$ Porcentaje de participación en los programas de cribado poblacional de cáncer de mama entre la población diana (mujeres de entre 50 y 69 años) $$PP_{mama}^{t} = \frac{P_{mama}^{t}}{P_{D\, mama}^{t}} \cdot 100$$ donde: $P_{mama}^{t} =$ número de participantes en el programa de detección precoz de cáncer de mama en el año $t$ $P_{D\, mama}^{t} =$ población diana del programa de detección precoz de cáncer de mama en el año $t$
es.observaciones: Hasta 2023 la población diana del programa de cribado poblacional de cáncer colorrectal estaba formada por hombres y mujeres de entre 50 y 69 años. A partir de 2023 se les sumó la población de entre 70 y 74 años.

11-1-1.graph_title: Proportion of people living in households with certain housing deficiencies
11-1-1.indicator_name: Proportion of urban population living in slums, informal settlements or inadequate housing

sources.organisation: Department of Welfare, Youth and Demographic Challenge
sources.url_text: Survey on Poverty and Social Inequalities (EPDS)

11-1-1.indicador_disponible: Proportion of people living in households with certain housing deficiencies
11-1-1.objetivo_global: 11- Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable
11-1-1.meta_global: 11.1 By 2030, ensure access for all to adequate, safe and affordable housing and basic services and upgrade slums
11-1-1.definicion:
Proportion of people who have certain deficiencies in their homes:

 - Moisture problems (leaking roof; damp walls, floors, ceilings, or foundations; or rot in window frames, doors, or floors)
 - housing without a toilet or bathtub/shower
 - problems of exposure to noise and pollution 
 - dark home, without enough light, or lack of natural light
11-1-1.formula:
$$PPDV^{t} = \frac{PDV^{t}}{P^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where: 

$PDV^{t} =$ population that experiences a certain deficiency in their housing conditions in year $t$ 

$P^{t} =$ total popùlation in year $t$
11-1-1.texto_oceca: The series ‘Proportion of people living in a home with humidity problems’ has been compiled  using a methodology harmonised among the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
11-1-1.justificacion_global:
The nature of the housing sector with its institutions, laws and regulations, 
is one that touches every single aspect of the economy of a country and has 
interface with practically every social development sector. 

People living in adequate homes have better health, higher chances to improve 
their human capital and seize the opportunities available in urban contexts. 
At the same time, a housing sector that performs well acts as a ‘development 
multiplier’ benefiting complementary industries, contributing to economic 
development, employment generation, service provision and overall poverty reduction. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
11-1-1.dato_global: Proportion of urban population living in slums (%) EN_LND_SLUM UNSTATS
11-1-1.comparabilidad: The available indicator does not comply with the metadata of the United Nations indicator, but provides complementary information.

es.indicador_disponible: Proportion of people living in households with certain housing deficiencies
es.objetivo_global: 11- Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable
es.meta_global: 11.1 By 2030, ensure access for all to adequate, safe and affordable housing and basic services and upgrade slums
es.definicion:
Proporción de personas que en sus viviendas tienen determinadas deficiencias:

 - problemas de humedad (techo con goteras; paredes, suelos, techos o cimientos con humedad, o podredumbre en marcos de ventanas, puertas o suelo)
 - vivienda sin retrete o bañera/ducha
 - problemas de exposición a ruidos y contaminación 
 - vivienda oscura, sin luz suficiente, o escasez de luz natural
es.formula:
$$PPDV^{t} = \frac{PDV^{t}}{P^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde: 

$PDV^{t} =$ población que experimenta una determinada deficiencia en la condiciones de su vivienda en el año $t$ 

$P^{t} =$ población total en el año $t$
es.texto_oceca: La serie "Proporción de personas que vive en una vivienda con problemas de humedad" está calculada utilizando una  metodología armonizada entre los órganos centrales de estadística de las comunidades autónomas.
es.justificacion_global:
La naturaleza del sector de la vivienda, con sus instituciones, leyes y reglamentos, 
afecta a todos los aspectos de la economía de un país y tiene interrelación con 
prácticamente todos los sectores del desarrollo social. 

Las personas que viven en viviendas adecuadas tienen mejor salud, mayores posibilidades 
de mejorar su capital humano y aprovechar las oportunidades disponibles en los contextos 
urbanos. Al mismo tiempo, un sector de la vivienda que funciona bien actúa como un 
"multiplicador del desarrollo" que beneficia a las industrias complementarias, 
contribuyendo al desarrollo económico, la generación de empleo, la prestación de 
servicios y la reducción general de la pobreza.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas

6-b-1.graph_title: Proportion of local administrative units with established and operational policies and procedures for participation of local communities in water and sanitation management
6-b-1.indicator_name: Proportion of local administrative units with established and operational policies and procedures for participation of local communities in water and sanitation management
6-b-1.indicador_disponible: Proportion of local administrative units with established and operational policies and procedures for participation of local communities in water and sanitation management
6-b-1.objetivo_global: 6- Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
6-b-1.meta_global: 6.b Support and strengthen the participation of local communities in improving water and sanitation management
6-b-1.definicion:
Proportion of local administrative units (municipalities) with established and operational policies 
and procedures for participation of local communities in drinking water and sanitation management 
and in bathing water management
6-b-1.formula:
$$PDAL_{water\, management}^{t} = \frac{DAL_{water\, management}^{t}}{DAL^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where:

$DAL_{water\, management}^{t} =$ local administrative units (municipalities) with established and operational policies 
and procedures for participation of local communities in water management in year $t$

$DAL^{t} =$ local administrative units (municipalities) in year $t$
6-b-1.observaciones: The indicator is 100% since local governments are responsible for the quality of drinking water,  and can manage its supply directly or through a manager (Royal Decree 140/2003, of February 7,  establishing the health criteria for the quality of drinking water). They are also responsible for  the management of bathing water (Royal Decree 1341/2007, of October 11, on the management of bathing  water quality).
6-b-1.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
6-b-1.justificacion_global:
Defining the procedures in policy or law for the participation of local communities is vital 
to ensure the needs of all the community are met, including the most vulnerable and also encourages 
ownership of schemes which in turn contributes to their sustainability. 

A low value of this indicator would suggest that participation of local communities in water and 
sanitation management is low, whereas a high value would indicate high levels of participation, 
indicating greater ownership and a higher likelihood of sustainable delivery and management of 
water and sanitation services. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
6-b-1.dato_global: Proportion of countries with high level of users/communities participating in planning programs in water resources planning and management (%) ER_WAT_PARTIC UNSTATS
6-b-1.comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with United Nations metadata.

es.indicador_disponible: Proportion of local administrative units with established and operational policies and procedures for participation of local communities in water and sanitation management
es.objetivo_global: 6- Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
es.meta_global: 6.b Support and strengthen the participation of local communities in improving water and sanitation management
es.definicion:
Proporción de dependencias administrativas locales (ayuntamientos) que 
han establecido políticas y procedimientos operacionales para la participación 
de las comunidades locales en la gestión y el saneamiento de aguas de consumo 
y en la gestión de aguas de baño
es.formula:
$$PDAL_{gestión\, de\, agua}^{t} = \frac{DAL_{gestión\, de\, agua}^{t}}{DAL^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde:

$DAL_{gestión\, de\, agua}^{t} =$ dependencias administrativas locales (ayuntamientos) que han establecido políticas y procedimientos operacionales para la gestión del agua en el año $t$

$DAL^{t} =$ dependencias administrativas locales (ayuntamientos) en el año $t$
es.observaciones: El indicador es del 100% ya que los ayuntamientos son responsables de la calidad  del agua de consumo humano, pudiendo gestionar su suministro directamente o a  través de un gestor (Real Decreto 140/2003, de 7 de febrero, por el que se  establecen los criterios sanitarios de la calidad del agua de consumo humano),  y son asimismo responsables de la gestión de las aguas de baño  (Real Decreto 1341/2007, de 11 de octubre, sobre la gestión de la calidad  de las aguas de baño)
es.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
es.justificacion_global:
Definir los procedimientos en las políticas o leyes para la participación 
de las comunidades locales es vital para garantizar que se satisfagan 
las necesidades de toda la comunidad, incluidas las de los más vulnerables, 
y también fomenta la apropiación de los planes, lo que a su vez contribuye 
a su sostenibilidad.

Un valor bajo de este indicador sugeriría que la participación de las 
comunidades locales en la gestión del agua y el saneamiento es baja, 
mientras que un valor alto indicaría altos niveles de participación, 
lo que indica una mayor apropiación y una mayor probabilidad de prestación 
y gestión sostenibles de los servicios de agua y saneamiento.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas

11-6-1.graph_title: Urban waste collected per capita and proportion of waste treated, by type of treatment
11-6-1.indicator_name: Proportion of municipal solid waste collected and managed in controlled facilities out of total municipal waste generated, by cities

sources.organisation: Department of Industry, Energy Transition and Sustainability

11-6-1.indicador_disponible: Urban waste collected per capita and proportion of waste treated, by type of treatment
11-6-1.objetivo_global: 11- Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable
11-6-1.meta_global: 11.6 By 2030, reduce the adverse per capita environmental impact of cities, including by paying special attention to air quality and municipal and other waste management
11-6-1.definicion:
Urban waste collected per capita and proportion of urban waste treated  in relation to total urban waste generated, and  the proportion of urban waste collected and managed in controlled facilities.
Urban or municipal waste is waste generated in private homes, businesses, offices,  and services, as well as any waste that, due  to its nature or composition, can be assimilated to that produced in the aforementioned places or activities.
The following are also considered urban waste:

 - Waste from cleaning public streets, green areas, recreational areas, and beaches

 - Dead domestic animals, as well as abandoned furniture, fixtures, and vehicles

 - Waste and debris from minor construction and home repairs
11-6-1.formula:
Urban waste collected per capita $$RURP^{t} = \frac{RUR^{t}}{P^{t}} $$ where: $RUR^{t} =$ amount of urban waste collected in year $t$ $P^{t} =$ population as of 1 July of year $t$
Proportion of urban waste collected and managed in controlled facilities $$PRUR^{t} = \frac{RUG^{t}}{RUR^{t}} \cdot 100$$ where: $RUG^{t} =$ amount of urban waste generated in year $t$ $RUR^{t} =$ amount of urban waste collected and managed in controlled facilities in year $t$
Proportion of urban waste treated, per treatment operation $$PRU_{treatment}^{t} = \frac{RU_{treatment}^{t}}{RU^{t}} \cdot 100$$
$RU_{treatment}^{t} =$ amount of urban waste treated (by type of treatment) in year $t$ $RUR^{t} =$ amount of urban waste collected and managed in controlled facilities in year $t$
11-6-1.texto_oceca: The series ‘Urban waste collected per capita’ and ‘Proportion of urban waste treated, per treatment operation’  have been compiled using a methodology harmonised among the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
11-6-1.justificacion_global:
Urban households and businesses produce substantial amounts of solid waste that 
must be collected regularly, recycled or treated and disposed properly in order 
to maintain healthy and sanitary living conditions. 

Many cities are increasingly facing solid waste management challenges due to rapid 
urbanization, lack of technical and financial capacity or low policy priority. In 
addition, the higher the income level of a city, the greater the amount of the solid 
waste produced. 

Therefore, the economic growth to be experienced in the developing and emerging 
countries will pose greater challenges in solid waste management to local governments 
in the next decades. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
11-6-1.comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with United Nations metadata
11-6-1.dato_global: Municipal Solid Waste collection coverage, by cities (%) EN_REF_WASCOL UNSTATS

es.indicador_disponible: Urban waste collected per capita and proportion of waste treated, by type of treatment

es.meta_global: 11.6 By 2030, reduce the adverse per capita environmental impact of cities, including by paying special attention to air quality and municipal and other waste management
es.definicion:
Residuos urbanos recogidos per cápita y proporción de residuos urbanos tratados en relación 
 al total de residuos urbanos generados, y la proporción de residuos urbanos gestionados 
 en instalaciones controladas.

Los residuos urbanos o municipales son los residuos generados en los domicilios particulares, comercios, oficinas y servicios, así como todos aquellos que que por su naturaleza o  composición puedan asimilarse a los producidos en los anteriores lugares o actividades.
Tienen también la consideración de residuos urbanos los siguientes:

 - Residuos procedentes de la limpieza de vías públicas, zonas verdes, áreas recreativas y playas

 - Animales domésticos muertos, así como muebles, enseres y vehículos abandonados

 - Residuos y escombros procedentes de obras menores de construcción y reparación domiciliaria
es.formula:
Residuos urbanos recogidos per cápita $$RURP^{t} = \frac{RUR^{t}}{P^{t}} $$ donde: $RUR^{t} =$ cantidad de residuos urbanos recogidos en el año $t$ $P^{t} =$ población a 1 de julio del año $t$
Proporción de residuos urbanos recogidos y gestionados en instalaciones controladas $$PRUR^{t} = \frac{RUG^{t}}{RUR^{t}} \cdot 100$$ donde: $RUG^{t} =$ cantidad de residuos urbanos generados en el año $t$ $RUR^{t} =$ cantidad de residuos urbanos recogidos y gestionados en instalaciones controladas en el año $t$
Proporción de residuos urbanos tratados, por operación de tratamiento $$PRU_{tratamiento}^{t} = \frac{RU_{tratamiento}^{t}}{RU^{t}} \cdot 100$$
donde: $RU_{tratamiento}^{t} =$ cantidad de residuos urbanos tratados (según tipo de tratamiento) en el año $t$ $RUR^{t} =$ cantidad total de residuos urbanos recogidos y gestionados en instalaciones controladas en el año $t$
es.desagregacion:
Operación de tratamiento de residuos  

Territorio histórico
es.texto_oceca: Las series "Residuos urbanos recogidos per cápita" y "Proporción de residuos urbanos tratados, por operación de tratamiento" se han calculado utilizando una metodología armonizada entre los órganos centrales de estadística de las comunidades autónomas
es.justificacion_global:
Los hogares y empresas urbanas generan cantidades sustanciales de residuos que deben recolectarse regularmente, 
reciclarse o tratarse y eliminarse adecuadamente para mantener condiciones de vida saludables 
e higiénicas. 

Muchas ciudades enfrentan cada vez más desafíos en la gestión de residuos
debido a la rápida urbanización, la falta de capacidad técnica y financiera o la baja prioridad 
política. Además, cuanto mayor es el nivel de ingresos de una ciudad, mayor es la cantidad de 
residuos sólidos que se producen. 

Por lo tanto, el crecimiento económico que experimentarán los países en desarrollo y emergentes 
planteará mayores desafíos a los gobiernos locales en la gestión de residuos en las próximas décadas.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
es.comparabilidad: La serie "Proporción de residuos urbanos recogidos y gestionados en instalaciones controladas" cumple con los metadatos de Naciones Unidas

sources.organisation: Department of Industry, Energy Transition and Sustainability

15-3-1.indicador_disponible: Area of ​​potentially contaminated soils recovered for new uses
15-3-1.objetivo_global: 15- Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
15-3-1.meta_global: 15.3 By 2030, combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world
15-3-1.definicion:
Area of ​​potentially contaminated soils recovered for new uses, accumulated since 2005 
and percentage with respect to the potentially contaminated area. 

A soil is considered to have been recovered if it has a Declaration of Soil Quality 
as provided for in Law 4/2015, of June 25, for the prevention and correction of soil 
contamination.
15-3-1.formula:
$$PSPC_{recovered}^{t} = \frac{SPC_{recovered}^{t}}{SPC^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where: 

$SPC_{recovered}^{t} =$ area of ​​potentially contaminated soils recovered for new uses from 2005 to year $t$

$SPC^{t} =$ area of ​​potentially contaminated soils in year $t$
15-3-1.justificacion_global:
Land degradation is defined as the reduction or loss of the biological or economic productivity and 
complexity of rain fed cropland, irrigated cropland, or range, pasture, forest and woodlands resulting 
from a combination of pressures, including land use and management practices. 

SDG indicator 15.3.1 is a binary - degraded/not degraded - quantification based on the analysis of 
available data for three sub-indicators: Trends in Land Cover, Land Productivity and Carbon Stocks. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
15-3-1.dato_global: Proportion of land that is degraded over total land area (%) AG_LND_DGRD UNSTATS
15-3-1.comparabilidad: The available indicator does not comply with the metadata of the United Nations indicator, but provides complementary information.

es.indicador_disponible: Area of ​​potentially contaminated soils recovered for new uses
es.objetivo_global: 15- Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
es.meta_global: 15.3 By 2030, combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world
es.definicion:
Superficie de suelos potencialmente contaminados y recuperados para nuevos usos acumulado desde el año 2005 y porcentaje respecto a la superficie potencialmente contaminada

Se considera que un suelo ha sido recuperado si dispone de la Declaración de la calidad 
del suelo según lo previsto en la Ley 4/2015, de 25 de junio, para la prevención y 
corrección de la contaminación del suelo.
es.formula:
$$PSPC_{recuperado}^{t} = \frac{SPC_{recuperado}^{t}}{SPC^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde: 

$SPC_{recuperado}^{t} =$ superficie de suelos potencialmente contaminados y recuperados para nuevos usos desde el año 2005 hasta el año $t$ 

$SPC^{t} =$ superficie de suelos potencialmente contaminados en el año $t$
es.justificacion_global:
La degradación de la tierra se define como la reducción o pérdida de la productividad 
biológica o económica y de la complejidad de las tierras de cultivo de secano, 
las tierras de cultivo de regadío o los pastizales, pastizales, bosques y zonas 
boscosas como resultado de una combinación de presiones, incluidas las prácticas de 
uso y gestión de la tierra. 

El indicador 15.3.1 de los ODS es una cuantificación binaria -degradado/no degradado- basada 
en el análisis de los datos disponibles para tres subindicadores: tendencias en la 
cobertura terrestre, productividad de la tierra y reservas de carbono.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
es.dato_global: Proporción de tierra degradada sobre la superficie total (%) AG_LND_DGRD UNSTATS

1-5-2.graph_title: Compensation for personal injury, pecuniary loss and property damage paid and/or provisioned in proportion to GDP
1-5-2.indicator_name: Direct economic loss attributed to disasters in relation to global gross domestic product (GDP)
1-5-2.indicador_disponible: Compensation for personal injury, pecuniary loss and property damage paid and/or provisioned in proportion to GDP
1-5-2.objetivo_global: 1- End poverty in all its forms everywhere
1-5-2.meta_global: 1.5 By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters
1-5-2.definicion: Proportion of compensation for personal injury, pecuniary loss and  property damage paid and/or provisioned (pending settlement or payment)  in relation to GDP at current prices
1-5-2.formula:
$$INDEMPIB^{t} = \frac{(IDP^{t}+IPP^{t}+IDB^{t})/IUIPC_{refT}^{t}}{PIB^{t}} \cdot 100 \quad \mathrm t=1,\dots,\mathrm T$$

$$IUIPC_{refT}^{T} = 1$$

$$IUIPC_{refT}^{t-1} = IUIPC_{refT}^{t} \cdot \frac{(100+TIPC_{dic}^{t})}{100} \quad \mathrm t=\mathrm T,\mathrm T-1,\dots,\mathrm 2$$

where:

$IDP^{t} =$ Compensation for personal injuries paid and/or provisioned in year $t$ at prices of year $T$

$IPP^{t} =$ Compensation for pecuniary losses paid and/or provisioned in year $t$ at prices of year $T$

$IDB^{t} =$ Compensation for property damage paid and/or provisioned in year $t$ at prices of year $T$

$TIPC_{dic}^{t} =$ annual variation rate of the national CPI in the month of December of year $t$ 

$PIB^{t} =$ gross domestic product at current prices in year $t$
1-5-2.observaciones: Compensation is assigned to the place and year of occurrence of the claim,  not including claims occurring abroad.
1-5-2.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
1-5-2.justificacion_global:
The Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015-2030 was adopted 
by United Nations Member States in March 2015 as a global disaster risk 
reduction policy.

Among its goals is Goal C: Reduce direct economic losses from disasters 
relative to global gross domestic product (GDP) by 2030.

Achieving its goals will contribute to sustainable development and strengthen 
economic, social, health, and environmental resilience.

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
1-5-2.comparabilidad: The available indicator does not comply with UN metadata, but provides similar information.

es.definicion: Proporción de indemnizaciones por daños personales, pérdidas pecuniarias  y daños de bienes pagadas y/o provisionadas (pendientes de liquidación o pago)  en relación al PIB a precios corrientes

$$IUIPC_{refT}^{T} = 1$$

$$IUIPC_{refT}^{t-1} = IUIPC_{refT}^{t} \cdot \frac{(100+TIPC_{dic}^{t})}{100} \quad \mathrm t=\mathrm T,\mathrm T-1,\dots,\mathrm 2$$

donde:

$IDP^{t}$ = indemnizaciones por daños personales pagadas y/o provisionadas en el año $t$ a precios del año $T$

es.observaciones: Las indemnizaciones se asignan al lugar y año de ocurrencia del siniestro,  no incluyendo los siniestros ocurridos en el extranjero

El Marco de Sendai para la Reducción del Riesgo de Desastres 2015-2030 fue 
adoptado por los Estados miembros de las Naciones Unidas en marzo de 2015 
como una política global de reducción del riesgo de desastres.

Entre sus metas se encuentra la Meta C: Reducir las pérdidas económicas directas 
por desastres en relación con el producto interno bruto (PIB) mundial para 2030.

La consecución de sus metas contribuirá al desarrollo sostenible y fortalecerá la 
resiliencia económica, social, sanitaria y ambiental.

16-1-4.graph_title: Proportion of population that feel safe walking alone around the area they live after dark
16-1-4.indicator_name: Proportion of population that feel safe walking alone around the area they live after dark
16-1-4.indicador_disponible: Proportion of the population that feels safe walking alone in their residential area after darke
16-1-4.objetivo_global: 16- Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
16-1-4.meta_global: 16.1 Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
16-1-4.definicion: Proportion of people aged 16 and over who feel safe (very or fairly safe) walking alone at night in the area they live in
16-1-4.formula:
$$PPSSC_{16+}^{t} = \frac{PSSC_{16+}^{t}}{P_{16+}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where:

$PSSC_{16+}^{t} =$ people aged 16 and over who feel safe (very or fairly safe) walking alone at night in the area they live in, in year $t$ 

$P^{t} =$ people aged 16 and over in year $t$
16-1-4.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
16-1-4.justificacion_global:
Perception of safety is considered a subjective wellbeing indicator. It affects the way in which human 
beings interact with their surroundings, their health, and consequently, their quality of life. 

Indicator 16.1.4 taps into the concept of ‘fear of crime’, which has been elicited in dozens of crime victimization 
surveys, and the standard formulation used here has been shown to be applicable in different cultural 
contexts. 

It is important to note that fear of crime is a phenomenon that is separate from the prevalence 
of crime and that fear of crime may be even largely independent from actual experience. The perception 
of crime and the resulting fear of it is influenced by several factors, such as the awareness of crime, the 
public discussion, the media discourse, and personal circumstances. 

Nevertheless, fear of crime is an important indicator in itself as high levels of fear can negatively influence 
well-being and lead to reduced contacts with the public, reduced trust and engagement in the community, and thus 
represent an obstacle to development. Fear of crime also differs across demographic groups and this indicator helps to 
identify vulnerable groups. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
16-1-4.comparabilidad: The available indicator complies with United Nations metadata.

es.indicador_disponible: Proportion of the population that feels safe walking alone in their residential area after darke
es.objetivo_global: 16- Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
es.meta_global: 16.1 Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
es.definicion: Proporción de personas de 16 y más años que se sienten seguras (muy o bastante seguras) al caminar solas de noche en la zona en la que vive
es.formula:
$$PPSSC_{16+}^{t} = \frac{PSSC_{16+}^{t}}{P_{16+}^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde:

$PSSC_{16+}^{t} =$ población de 16 y más años que se siente segura (muy o bastante segura) al caminar sola de noche en la zona en la que vive en el año $t$ 

$P^{t} =$ población de 16 y más años en el año $t$
es.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
es.justificacion_global:
La percepción de seguridad se considera un indicador subjetivo de bienestar. 
Afecta la forma en que los seres humanos interactúan con su entorno, su salud y, 
en consecuencia, su calidad de vida. 

El indicador 16.1.4 se basa en el concepto de “miedo al delito”, que se ha obtenido en 
docenas de encuestas de victimización por delitos, y la formulación estándar utilizada 
aquí ha demostrado ser aplicable en diferentes contextos culturales.

Es importante señalar que el miedo al delito es un fenómeno que está separado de la 
prevalencia del delito y que el miedo al delito puede incluso ser en gran medida 
independiente de la experiencia real. La percepción del delito y el miedo resultante 
al mismo están influenciados por varios factores, como la conciencia del delito, 
el discurso público, el discurso de los medios de comunicación y las circunstancias 
personales. 

Sin embargo, el miedo al delito es un indicador importante en sí mismo, ya que 
los altos niveles de miedo pueden influir negativamente en el bienestar y conducir a 
una reducción de los contactos con el público, una menor confianza y compromiso en 
la comunidad y, por lo tanto, representar un obstáculo para el desarrollo. El miedo 
al delito también difiere entre los grupos demográficos y este indicador ayuda a 
identificar a los grupos vulnerables.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
es.comparabilidad: El indicador disponible cumple con los metadatos de Naciones Unidas.

3-5-1.graph_title: Number of admissions to treatment for alcohol and illegal drug abuse or dependence per 100,000 inhabitants
3-5-1.indicator_name: Coverage of treatment interventions (pharmacological, psychosocial and rehabilitation and aftercare services) for substance use disorders
3-5-1.indicador_disponible: Number of admissions to treatment for alcohol and illegal drug abuse or dependence per 100,000 inhabitants
3-5-1.objetivo_global: 3- Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
3-5-1.meta_global: 3.5 Strengthen the prevention and treatment of substance abuse, including narcotic drug abuse and harmful use of alcohol
3-5-1.definicion: Number of first-time outpatient treatment admissions for addictive substance abuse or dependence  at a treatment center in a given year per 100,000 population
3-5-1.formula:
$$TAT_{addictive\, substances}^{t} = \frac{AT_{addictive\, substances}^{t}}{P^{t}} \cdot 100.000$$

where:

$AT_{addictive\, substances}^{t} =$ Number of admissions to outpatient treatment for addictive substance abuse or 
dependence at a treatment center for the first time in the year $t$

$P^{t} =$ population on July 1 of year $t$
3-5-1.observaciones:
There may be some overestimation of the indicator at the state level, given that the same person may 
have been notified in two or more different communities and their identification is not possible for 
confidentiality reasons.

Treatment: Any intervention performed by qualified professionals to eliminate, reduce, or control drug use.

Outpatient: the person does not spend the night at the facility. This criterion does not apply to penitentiary centers.

Illegal drugs: Alcohol and nicotine (tobacco) are not considered illegal drugs.
3-5-1.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
3-5-1.justificacion_global:
This United Nations indicator measures the coverage of treatment interventions for substance 
use disorders is defined as the number of people who received treatment in a year divided by 
the total number of people with substance use disorders in the same year. This indicator is 
disaggregated by two broad groups of psychoactive substances: (1) drugs, (2) alcohol and other 
psychoactive substances.

According to United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) and World Health Organization (WHO) 
data, around 296 million people aged 15 to 64 years worldwide used an illicit drug at least once in 
2021, about 2.3 billion people are current drinkers of alcohol, some 35 million of people suffer 
from drug use disorders and 289 million from alcohol use disorders.

Substance use disorders are serious health conditions that present a significant burden for affected 
individuals, their families and communities. Untreated substance use disorders trigger substantial costs 
to society including lost productivity, increased health care expenditure, and costs related to criminal 
justice, social welfare, and other social consequences.

Strengthening treatment services entails providing access to a comprehensive set of evidence-based 
interventions (-laid down in the international standards and guidelines) that should be available 
to all population groups in need. The indicator will inform the extent to which a range of evidence-based
interventions for treatment of substance use disorder are available and are accessed by the population 
in need at country, regional and global level.

Even though effective treatment exists, only a small amount of people with substance use disorders 
receive it. For instance, it is estimated that globally one out of 7 people with drug use disorders 
have access to or provided drug treatment services (World Drug Report 2019). WHO ATLAS-Substance 
Use data showed that in 2014 only 11.9 % (out of 103 responding) countries reported high coverage (40% 
or more) for alcohol dependence. SDG indicator 3.5.1 is crucial for measurement the progress 
towards strengthening the treatment of substance abuse worldwide as formulated in the Target 3.5. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
3-5-1.dato_global: Coverage of treatment interventions (pharmacological, psychosocial and rehabilitation and aftercare services) for substance use disorders (%) SH_SUD_TREAT UNSTATS
3-5-1.comparabilidad: The available indicator does not meet the UN indicator metadata requirements, but provides  complementary information.
